result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman W Krukowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Shall submit a DNA sample. 
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. 
Court allows contact with victim.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling/treatment as directed by agent.

3:31 PM  Defendant Norman W Krukowski in court.  Attorney Teri Strohschein in court for Norman W Krukowski.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliance. Court review rights, charges and penalties. Defendant enters NC plea to Count 1 of Amended Information Battery/Domestic. Court accepts plea; finds guilty of Count 1; Counts 2 DRI.  Attorney Tienstra heard. Atty Strohschein heard. Defendant makes statement. Court heard and imposes sentence: 

Sent w/h
2 yrs probation by 4pm 9/14/22
Absolute Sobriety
Comply with recommendations for treatment/counseling
Counseling as directed by Agent
May have contact with victim however may not have violent or abusive contact 
Costs
DNA sample and surcharge

Pre sent credit of 3 days
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 24, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Court resets Review and Prelim.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim, their residence and their child. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Norman W Krukowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein (may be eligible) appeared by video for Norman W Krukowski. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim, victim's residence and victim's child. Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
